results.title: Friends and other people
results.creator_credit: Centre for Study of Higher Education
results.brief_description: A teaching model used to educate the intellectually disabled about types of relationships, clarifying social norms and behavioural expectations,in order to deal with loneliness, low self esteem and vulnerability to exploitation. Includes a booklet by Susie Smith and Judi Gray.

results.title: Friendly Fiji
results.brief_description: Fiji, one time home of warring tribes, is now a peace loving island with a thriving tourist trade. Palm beaches, ocean waters, traditional native ceremonies, and the cosmopolitan capital of Suva are among the many attractions. Outlines Fiji’s history from the first missionaries, to British Dependency in 1874, and the present government. Shows the ceremonial opening of the Legislative Council, soldiers in parade dres, and the official raising of the flag.

results.title: French from France: to swim like a fish = Nager comme un poisson
results.creator_credit: Michael Style, Donald Carter, Associated Television and Schools Broadcast
results.brief_description: French language training film. Teaches French conversation, at the beach. Two girls sunbathe, swim, meet their friends and play a ball game. Their lively chatter using a wide vocabulary entertains and helps students with pronunciation in a natural way. Script by Jean Pierre Angremy, starring Claude Carroll as Marianne and Francois Apestoguy as Monique and members of the Comedie De L’Quest, Centre Dramatique National.

results.title: Freestyle and backstroke
results.brief_description: Part of the Competitive swimming series. Studies the underwater action of a team of Olympic swimmers. Demonstrates arm stroke technique, the twobeat kick and sixbeat flutter kick and breathing techniques. Excellent underwater photography. Variation between male and female swimmers.

results.title: Freedom of the Boomerang
results.brief_description: Highly commended ” make a stamp come alive” entry to Screen It! A man visiting a post office unwittingly unleashes a magical boomerang into the world. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Francesca baby
results.creator_credit: Larry S. Elikann, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the novel of the same title by Joan L. Oppenheimer, about a teenage girl and her younger sister who try to cope with their alcoholic mother. Shows how the teenage girl joins Alateen and how a series of dramatic events mark the beginning of a new life for the girls.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 75/09]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Technology: Franco-American engine - a ten ton thrust jet engine. High voltage - working toward the one million volt line for electric networks. 2. Conceptions - novel chair designs. 3. Cities of art - exhibits presented by France’s historic cities and towns. 4. From David to Delacroix - French painting from 1774 to 1830.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 75/07]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. In the news: The mole - a regional express metro line of Paris nearing completion. The tortoise - for underwater nuclear-medium use. 2. Ground flyers - flight simulators. 3. The poet’s club - for lovers of poetry. 4. The arts - Jean Marchand, author, alias “Mercator”, painter.
